parts.japanese: ニール：ようやくついたな。結局海底トンネルを一カ月近く歩いたんだなあ…
parts.thammy: Neil: I guess we've finally arrived. I think we were walking in the undersea tunnel for about a month in the end...

parts.japanese: ロブ：あれ？立てふだがあるぜ。
parts.thammy: Rob: Huh? There's a bulletin board.

parts.japanese: ロブ：なになに？だ天使族？旅人はこの部屋を使ってください？
parts.thammy: Rob: Let's see here. Fallen angel clan? Travelers, please use this room?

parts.japanese: ニール：だ天使族っていうのはこんなところに住んでいたのか..
parts.thammy: Neil: So the people living in this place are called the fallen angel clan..

parts.japanese: ニール：彼らは自分から人に会いたがらないっていうからな。
parts.thammy: Neil: I guess they put up that sign because they don't want to meet people themselves.

parts.japanese: まずはその部屋で休ませてもらうとするか…
parts.thammy: Before anything else, shall we try to get some rest in that room…?

parts.japanese: リリィ：テム。行こっ。
parts.thammy: Lillie: Tim. Let's go…

parts.japanese: カレン：何が"テム行こっ"よっ！
parts.thammy: Karen: What is this "Tim, let's go"...!

parts.japanese: テムもテムよ。でれでれしちゃってさ。
parts.thammy: You too, Tim! You're flirting.

parts.japanese: あたし一人であたりを見物してくる！ついてこないでよっ！！
parts.thammy: I'm going sightseeing alone! Don't come with me...!!

parts.japanese: リリィ：何をカリカリしてるんだか…
parts.thammy: Lillie: What is she so touchy about...

parts.japanese: ロブ：まあいつものおじょうさまの気まぐれさ。ほっとくんだな。
parts.thammy: Rob: Geez, always tha fickle little lady. Leave her alone, I guess.

parts.japanese: 旅人の方はこちらの部屋をお使い下さい。 ／ だ天使族
parts.thammy: Travelers, please use this room. / Fallen angel clan

parts.japanese: だ天使の町入口
parts.thammy: Entrance to fallen angel's town

parts.japanese: ロブ：テム。お前に一つそうだんがあるんだけどさ。
parts.thammy: Rob: Tim. Tha thing is, I've got somethin' to discuss with ya...

parts.japanese: 言いにくいんだけどおれリリィのことを好きになっちまったみたいなんだ…
parts.thammy: I hate to say it, but it seems like I've developed feelin's for Lillie...

parts.japanese: 夢だって彼女の夢ばっかりだし..気づくとリリィのことを目で追ってるんだよ。
parts.thammy: Even when I dream, I only dream o' her... Before I knew it, she had caught my eye.

parts.japanese: おれらしくないと思ってるだろ？ ／ うんっ ／ そんなことないさ
parts.thammy: Ya think that's not like me, right? / Yeah... / That isn't true

parts.japanese: テム：そうだね。ロブからそんな話がでてくるとは思ってもみなかったよ。
parts.thammy: Tim: That's right. I've never thought that you'd be saying things like that.

parts.japanese: テム：でもこれだけ長い間いっしょにいるんだもの。恋をしても不自然じゃないさ。
parts.thammy: Tim: But by you've spent a lot of time together by now. It wouldn't be unnatural even to be in love with her.

parts.japanese: ロブ：それでさ。もうじきリリィの１５才のたんじょう日がくるらしいんだ。
parts.thammy: Rob: Speakin' o' that. It seems like Lillie's fifteenth birthday is comin' up soon.

parts.japanese: そのときプレゼントといっしょにおれの気持ちを話したいんだけどお前ならどれがいいとおもう？
parts.thammy: I want to tell her my feelin's with a present then, but what do ya think I should go with?

parts.japanese: きれいな花たば ／ すてきなネックレス ／ あまーいキス
parts.thammy: A pretty bouquet / A wonderful necklace / A tender kiss

parts.japanese: テム：花たばをもらってうれしくない女の子はいないと思うよ。
parts.thammy: Tim: I don't think there's a girl out there who wouldn't be happy to get a bouquet of flowers.

parts.japanese: ロブ：やっぱりそうだよな。じゃあ花ことばで告白って意味のつぼみのバラを送ってみるかなあ。
parts.thammy: Rob: I guess that's expected. Well, I think I can try to communicate a love confession through tha language of flowers; rosebuds.

parts.japanese: テム：やっぱりふだん身につけられるものがいいんじゃない？
parts.thammy: Tim: Of course, shouldn't it be something that she regularly wears?

parts.japanese: それを見るたびにロブのこと思い出すわけだしさ。
parts.thammy: Because whenever she sees it, she'll think about how Rob is doing.

parts.japanese: ロブ：なるほどなあ。じゃあきれいな石でもさがしてネックレスをつくってみるよ。
parts.thammy: Rob: Ah, I get it. Well then, I'll try searching for pretty stones or something like that and making a necklace.

parts.japanese: テム：本当に好きならこれしかないだろ？
parts.thammy: Tim: If you truly like her there's nothing else but this, right?

parts.japanese: ロブ：いきなりだいたんすぎるような気もするけどお前がそういうならやってみるか…
parts.thammy: Rob: I feel like doing that all of a sudden would be too bold, but if you say so, should I try it...?

parts.japanese: ロブ：そうだんにのってくれてサンキュ。
parts.thammy: Rob: Thanks fer lending me yer advice.

parts.japanese: 自分なりに考えてみるよ。もつべきものは友だちだなあ。
parts.thammy: I'll try to think of it in my own way. Good friends are nice to have, ain't they.

parts.japanese: リリィ：だ天使族ってこんな暗い所でくらしてるんだね。気がめいっちゃいそう…
parts.thammy: Lillie: The people that call themselves the fallen angel clan live in a gloomy place like this, huh. It's seems depressing…

parts.japanese: エリック：太陽の光ってすっごく明るかったんだなあ。いつも見てるのに気づかなかった。
parts.thammy: Eric: Sunlight is iiincredibly bright. Even though I've always had it around, I hadn't noticed.

parts.japanese: ニール：だ天使族こそがムーの人々の子孫じゃないかとぼくは思っているのさ。
parts.thammy: Neil: I had been thinking, mustn't the fallen angel clan be the descendants of the Mu people?

parts.japanese: ここはだ天使の町。我々は体が弱く太陽の光さえも長時間あびると死んでしまうのだ。
parts.thammy: This is the fallen angels' village. Our bodies are weak; we'd die even if we were in the sunlight for too long.

parts.japanese: ここはだ天使の町。我々は体が弱く太陽の光さえも長時間あびると死んでしまうのだ。
parts.thammy: This is the fallen angels' village. Our bodies are weak; we'd die even if we were in the sunlight for too long.

parts.japanese: ここはだ天使の町。我々は体が弱く太陽の光さえも長時間あびると死んでしまうのだ。
parts.thammy: This is the fallen angels' village. Our bodies are weak; we'd die even if we were in the sunlight for too long.

parts.japanese: ここはだ天使の町。我々は体が弱く太陽の光さえも長時間あびると死んでしまうのだ。
parts.thammy: This is the fallen angels' village. Our bodies are weak; we'd die even if we were in the sunlight for too long.

parts.japanese: 人間が進化した形があたしたちだっていう話もあるわ。
parts.thammy: There are stories that say we evolved from humans.

parts.japanese: さっきカレンとかいう人間の女の子がきたわよ。
parts.thammy: A short time ago, a human girl came here; her name was Karen or something like that.

parts.japanese: イシタルっていう画家に美しさをほめられて彼のアトリエへ行ったみたいね。
parts.thammy: It seems that she went to the studio of the artist, Ishtar. His paintings are praised for their beauty, you know?

parts.japanese: アトリエへの道順を教えるからしっかり覚えてね。
parts.thammy: I'll teach you the route to the studio, so remember it, alright?

parts.japanese: まずは風について行くの。これはたいまつの火がなびく方向を見ていればわかるはず。
parts.thammy: First of all, follow the wind. You'll understand if you look at which direction the flames of the torches are bending in.

parts.japanese: 暗ヤミの通路をとおって強風の吹きあれる場所をぬけていくとそのうちたきの音が聞こえる場所にでるわ。
parts.thammy: You can hear the sound of a waterfall where the strong wind storms through the dark passage.

parts.japanese: そしたらたきの音がもっとも大きく聞こえるところをしらべてごらんなさい。
parts.thammy: Subsequently, please examine the area where the waterfall's sound is the loudest.

parts.japanese: その先がイシタルのアトリエ。気をつけてね。
parts.thammy: Ishtar's studio is beyond there. Be careful, alright?

parts.japanese: これは人間たちのごらくの一つでダンスというもの。
parts.thammy: This is something called "dance"; a way that humans amuse themselves.

parts.japanese: 人間の感情に近づきたくてこうして毎日おどってくらしても何も変わることはない…
parts.thammy: We want to get closer to human emotions, so we dance like this every day. Even so, nothing changes...

parts.japanese: そこのカベにかかっている絵はイシタルという画家がかいたものさ。
parts.thammy: The picture attached to that wall was painted by an artist called Ishtar.

parts.japanese: ただ彼の絵のモデルになった人はその後行方不明になるんだ…
parts.thammy: However, the models for his pictures go missing afterward...

parts.japanese: イシタルは無表情の私たちを人間味あふれた顔にえがいてくれる。
parts.thammy: Though we lack emotions, Ishtar draws us overflowing with human kindness.

parts.japanese: その後自分がどうなるかわからなくてもえがいてほしいという人が後をたたないわ。
parts.thammy: There is no end to the people who want Ishtar to draw them even though they don't know what will happen to them afterward.

parts.japanese: 私といっしょにおどっていた人は今はそこの絵の中。
parts.thammy: The person who was my dance partner is now inside of that painting.

parts.japanese: 我々がいつの時代からここに住みはじめたのかはわかりません。
parts.thammy: We don't know from what era we started living here.

parts.japanese: でも海を見るとなぜかむねが苦しくなるんですよ。
parts.thammy: But our chests hurt for some reason when we see the ocean.

parts.japanese: 私たちには感情がない…
parts.thammy: We have no emotions...

parts.japanese: 生まれてからこれまで笑ったこともないしなみだを流したこともない。ただ毎日を生きるだけ…
parts.thammy: We never laugh or cry from the day we are born. In our lives, every day is the same...

parts.japanese: ハープひきの女：音楽は何よりの心の薬。
parts.thammy: Woman playing the harp: Music is the greatest medicine for the soul.

parts.japanese: すてきな曲を聞けばどんな病気でもよくなるものよ。
parts.thammy: No matter what disease you face, you will become well if you hear a wonderful composition.

parts.japanese: おっと集めた宝石が２０コを越えているじゃないかっ！リストの通りサイコパワーをあげることにしよう。
parts.thammy: Whoops, the number of jewels you've collected have passed 20, haven't they...! Going by the list, I'll give you Psycho Power.

parts.japanese: これは私がたましいからさずかった世にも不思議な力。
parts.thammy: This is a mysterious, otherworldly power that I will award you from my soul.

parts.japanese: 何でもサイコダッシュのこうげき力が上がるらしいのだ。
parts.thammy: It seems like the Psycho Dash's attack power rose.

parts.japanese: 私はちょうこく家。死ぬまでにこの石像を１０００体作るつもりだよ…
parts.thammy: I'm a sculptor. Before I die, I intend to make a thousand of these statues...

parts.japanese: テム：たましいをぬかれたようにまるで意識がない…
parts.thammy: Tim: They have no consciousness, as if their soul had been removed...

parts.japanese: 画家のイシタルのことを知っているか？ ／ はい ／ いいえ
parts.thammy: Do you know the painter, Ishtar? / Yes / No

parts.japanese: ならばみんなの話をもう少し聞いてくるがいい。
parts.thammy: In that case, you should listen a little more to what everyone has to say.

parts.japanese: 画家イシタルのアトリエはこのトビラの向こうがわ。
parts.thammy: The studio of Ishtar, the painter, is on the other side of this door.

parts.japanese: だがこの先にはにくしみとはかいの心しかもたない生物がうごめいているのだ。
parts.thammy: But there are creatures with nothing but hatred and a desire for destruction that are squirming from beyond this point.

parts.japanese: それでもゆくというのならとびらを開けるがいい。
parts.thammy: If you say you still want to go despite that, you may open the door.
